text: Olinda Beja (born December 8, 1946) is a São Tomé and Príncipe poet, writer and narrator. Later she immigrated to Portugal and moved to Viseu and later became a Portuguese citizen. ==Biography== She was born in Guadalupe on São Tomé Island in 1946 to Portuguese José de Beja Martins and native Santomean Maria da Trindade Filipe. For about 12 years inhabited in the wonderful islands, she later lived across the sea in the cold lands of Beira Alta, Portugal. She got a license in Modern Languages, French and Portuguese at the University of Porto, Beja was a teacher at the Secondary School from 1976. She teaches Portuguese language and culture in Switzerland, and is a cultural advisor to the ambassador of São Tomé e Príncipe.http://nescritas.com/poetasapaixonados/listapoesiasdeamor2/1991/05/ She won the Francisco José Tenreiro Literary Award in 2013 on her work A Sombra do Ocá. In 2015, she wrote a book titled Um Grão de Café (Coffee Bean) with the National Literary Plan of Portugal. ==Published works== * Bô Tendê? – poems– 1992 – 2nd ed. – C.M Aveiro; * Leve, Leve - poems - 1993- 2nd ed.
